channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024070184
item.description:
Report X-2024070184

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: GRAND JUNCTION
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE BOTTLES IN THIS BOX WERE PACKAGED UPSIDE DOWN IN RELATION TO THE ORIENTATION ARROWS. THE LIDS LOOSENED AND ONLY ONE HAD ITS SEAL BREAK RELEASING ITS CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2024070119
item.description:
Report X-2024070119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The contents of this shipment began to spill after the lids popped open becoming slightly ajar. This likely could have been avoided through the inclusion of more inner packing and the inclusion of a LQ diamond on the outer packing as the package probably would have been handled as a LQ shipment.
